boardgame.name: Dice Town
骰子鎮
boardgame.description: Each player gets a cup with five poker dice and eight dollars. Each turn, a player will put together a poker hand and depending on the roll, take control of various key places in Dice Town that will allow him to perform the corresponding action of the location._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In a turn, all players shake their cup and take out all but one die, which is kept apart from the others. They repeat the process with the remaining dice until all five dice are on the table. Players may want to keep more than one die; they pay one dollar for each additional die._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Now the locations are checked..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Nines: In the gold mine, the player with the most 9's may take one nugget from the mine for each nine he has thrown._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Tens: In the bank, the player with the most 10's may rob the bank and take all bills there - each two bills represent one victory point at game end._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Jacks: The player who has the most J's goes to the general store and draws as many cards as he had thrown J's, keeping one. These cards may give from one to eight points, or entitle a player to perform the saloon or general store action twice in a row, place a die with a result of a player's choice under the cup without rolling, or steal 4 dollars from another player. There are many more cards of this kind that spice up the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Queens: The player with the most Q's in his roll wins the favor of the girls, and takes advantage of their charm to steal from an opponent. He may take as many cards from his opponent as he has thrown Q's, keeping one and giving back the others._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Kings: The player with the most K's becomes the new sheriff; he decides who wins in any ties, but the sheriff can be influenced with nuggets, cards, or money._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Aces/Poker hand: In the town hall, the player with the best poker hand gets a property claim worth from one to five victory points. Having aces in the best poker hand permits taking additional cards._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Finally, if a player did not win anything during a turn, he might visit Doc Badluck where he can choose any one of the following:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- equip oneself with barbed wire - the player has two property claims that cannot be stolen;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- draw the first card from the general store pile;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- all other players must give the player two dollars;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- an ace will bring a nugget from every other player._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when there are no more gold nuggets in the mine or when all property claims have been issued. Players count their points: 1 for each nugget, 1 for every two dollars, 5 for whomever is currently sheriff, and each general store and property card for its value._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Asmodee Editions (ASM DIT01FUD) Welcome to Dice Town, the city of luck and prosperity! Here, we admire the Brave and Love Winners; especially those willing to bet their future on a roll of a dice! But you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll find that being clever also pays well, if you know how to adapt and bring your own luck to the table. Opportunities are everywhere in our proud town: gold nuggets are knee deep in the mine, the bank has too many dollars and the mayor is a quick dealer when it comes to handing out Property Claims. Unless you fancy a Sheriff_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s badge or just want to hang out in the Saloon? In Dice town, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re the boss, and anything can happen! Dice town is a fast and clever game for 2 to 5 players, that uses Poker Dice. A little luck, a hint of bluff and some good tactics are necessary in order to become the town_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s richest citizen. Both fun and intelligent, Dice Town is for everyone. When the game is over, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re going to want to play another one right away.

Asmodee Editions (ASM DIT01FUD) Welcome to Dice Town, the city of luck and prosperity! Here, we admire the Brave and Love Winners; especially those willing to bet their future on a roll of a dice! But you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll find that being clever also pays well, if you know how to adapt and bring your own luck to the table. Opportunities are everywhere in our proud town: gold nuggets are knee deep in the mine, the bank has too many dollars and the mayor is a quick dealer when it comes to handing out Property Claims. Unless you fancy a Sheriff_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s badge or just want to hang out in the Saloon? In Dice town, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re the boss, and anything can happen! Dice town is a fast and clever game for 2 to 5 players, that uses Poker Dice. A little luck, a hint of bluff and some good tactics are necessary in order to become the town_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s richest citizen. Both fun and intelligent, Dice Town is for everyone. When the game is over, you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re going to want to play another one right away.

Asmodée (ASM DIT01FUD) Each player gets a cup with five poker dice and eight dollars. Each turn a player will put together a poker hand and depending on the roll, take control of various key places in Dice Town that will allow him to perform the corresponding action of the location. In a turn, all players shake their cup and take out all but one die which is kept apart. They repeat the process with the remaining dice until all five dice are on the table. Players may want to keep more than one die; they pay one dollar for each additional die. Now the locations are checked... Nines: In the gold mine, the player with the most 9_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s may take one nugget from the mine for each nine he has thrown. Tens: In the bank, the player with the most 10_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s may rob the bank and take all bills there - each two bills represent one victory point at game end. Jacks: The player who has the most J_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s goes to the general store and draws as many cards as he had thrown J_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s, keeping one. These cards may give from one to eight points, or entitle a player to perform the saloon or general store action twice in a row, place a die with a result of a player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s choice under the cup without rolling, or steal 4 dollars from another player. There are many more cards of this kind that spice up the game. Queens: The player with the most Q_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s in his roll wins the favor of the girls, and takes advantage of their charm to steal from an opponent. He may take as many cards from his opponent as he has thrown Q_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s, keeping one and giving back the others. Kings: The player with the most K_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s becomes the new sheriff; he decides who wins in any ties, but the sheriff can be influenced with nuggets, cards or money. Aces/Poker hand: In the town hall the player with the best poker hand gets a property claim worth from one to five victory points. Having aces in the best poker hand permits taking additional cards. Finally, if a player did not win anything during a turn, he might visit Doc Badluck where he can choose any one of the following: - equip oneself with barbed wire - the player has two property claims that cannot be stolen; - draw the first card from the general store pile; - all other players must give the player two dollars; - an ace will bring a nugget from every other player. The game ends when there are no more gold nuggets in the mine or when all property claims have been issued. Players count their points: 1 for each nugget, 1 for every two dollars, 5 for whomever is currently sheriff, and each general store and property card for its value.
Played a few times.
Played a few times, complete.

Theme: Each player gets a cup with five poker dice and eight dollars. Each turn a player will put together a poker hand and depending on the roll, take control of various key places in Dice Town that will allow him to perform the corresponding action of the location. In a turn, all players shake their cup and take out all but one die which is kept apart. They repeat the process with the remaining dice until all five dice are on the table. Players may want to keep more than one die; they pay one dollar for each additional die. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.

Asmodee (ASMDIT01FUD) Who will own the town when the dice are rolled? Gold mines are lush prairie land await, drawing pioneers and settlers like bears to honey. Prospectors and bank robbers, cattle barons and swindlers descend on the town, all competing to cut off the biggest piece for themselves. Opportunities are everywhere, if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re smart enough - and lucky enough - to snatch them up. Dice Town is the poker game of dice and land grabs, where your roll determines your luck, not the other way around. Roll the poker dice and build the hand that gets you what you want. Rob the bank, mine for gold, or settle the land, but be smart, because only the best rolls can win, and there_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s always someone willing to steal your hard-won rewards right out from under you. If your hand isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t what you hoped it would be, you can always pay to try again - as long as you can afford it, that is. Featuring high-quality poker dice, plastic dice cups and beautiful illustrations, Dice Town will entertain two to five players and wrap up in less than an hour. Spend your money to make the best hand you can, because in this town, luck may decide the winner, but the best players make their own luck.

Cleaning out the warehouse. Newest edition from ASMODEE EDITIONS. Two day Shipping is $9.54 to anywhere in the United States.

Asmodee (ASMDIT01FUD) Who will own the town when the dice are rolled? Gold mines are lush prairie land await, drawing pioneers and settlers like bears to honey. Prospectors and bank robbers, cattle barons and swindlers descend on the town, all competing to cut off the biggest piece for themselves. Opportunities are everywhere, if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re smart enough - and lucky enough - to snatch them up. Dice Town is the poker game of dice and land grabs, where your roll determines your luck, not the other way around. Roll the poker dice and build the hand that gets you what you want. Rob the bank, mine for gold, or settle the land, but be smart, because only the best rolls can win, and there_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s always someone willing to steal your hard-won rewards right out from under you. If your hand isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t what you hoped it would be, you can always pay to try again - as long as you can afford it, that is. Featuring high-quality poker dice, plastic dice cups and beautiful illustrations, Dice Town will entertain two to five players and wrap up in less than an hour. Spend your money to make the best hand you can, because in this town, luck may decide the winner, but the best players make their own luck.
